rComments: awesome subject taught by a highly proficient master of the field

Pretty easy class. You don't have to even shoe up to class. Just watch some videos and look at his guides to do the hw. Some of the material on the tests are based on what he says in class, which sucks.

This course isn't within the field of my major (MCD Bio), but I took this class to fulfill a PR requirement. Throughout my almost 4 years here, this was the easiest class for me to get an A+ in. Tip: Make sure HW assignments and long term project covers all the requirements he gives you. Attend reviews before exams.

CMPM 25 was great class. He grades fairly, explains things very well, kept the 2 hour lectures interesting. Relatively easy A for those experienced in Blender or 3D modeling. Homework takes a bit of time, but is thoroughly enjoyable. 1010 would take again
Overall an easy course. I enjoyed it and didn't stress very much over it.

Lectures largely consisted of technical demonstrations which were to be replicated in the weekly assignments. Prof. was incredibly knowledgeable, and I'd strongly recommend him for this or any other class pertaining to animation or 3D graphics.

Chris is professional, enthusiastic, extremely knowledgable, caring with his students. He is always willing to help and give guidance. He is extremely clear on everything he teaches and strives to answer all questions, no matter how confusing they are. It was not a difficult class if you show up and do the work. Take this if you get a chance!

Chris is a good professor the work isn't easy by any means and is tedious, but I think it's a fun interesting class at the same time. Be prepared to lose some sleep if you aren't use to using computer programs. Got a B even though it took me a long time to do most of the assignments. I recommend communicating with TA's often it helps.

Yonge is a very good lecturer. His lectures are a bit like live tutorials, walking the class through various ways to use Blender 3D modeling software. Learned a lot. Probably going to be tough for those without some prior experience in 3D modeling or with computers. Very involved but interesting assignments.

Definitely a cool class to learn from if you are into graphic design or modeling in general. However, if you like me, who are taking it just for the purpose of satisfying a GE requirement, then better take something else. Is definitely not a class you want to spend extraneous amount of time in.

I thought this class would be really fun and it seemed like the best PR ge at ucsc. I was wrong. If you are not really into 3D modeling already and have a background in the subject the class might be too fast/complex for you like it was for me. Lectures are not useful for actually learning the subject... but they are entertaining sometimes.

Very cool class; however, it does not mean it is easy. This is no easy A. Assignments take time and some effort. Yonge is not very good at teaching, so you'll have to rely on books, online tutorials. I rarely went to class, taught myself, and came out with a B+. I recommend Yonge if you want to get into 3D modeling as a profession in the future.

Chris is a good teacher, his class is just not suited for lecture-style instruction. Fortunately he provides tutorials for most of his assignments. You don't have to go to lectures and unless you immediately go home and work on blender there is no reason to attend. He's willing to help outside class. Also as stated by others his accent is glorious

Blender is on of the easiest programs to work with, and you will be making amazing animations just  by the  end of this class if you pay attention and practice like i did. You do not need the textbook, it is useless. Make sure you ask him to talk to you in his american accent ( it is so funny) ;)  HAVE FUN!!

This is an introductory course for the Blender interface, and I came into it with no previous knowledge. Cool lectures, but you are going to have to do work on your own; online tutorials, book, and going to lab. Doable, but takes more time than you would want.

I love this professor. He has a British accent which is always fun. His tests are super easy multiple choice. I learned A LOT about blender in his class. All you have to do is do the easy assignments, follow the instructions, and just learn the basics of Blender. It's up to you if you actually want to put more effort in and make better models.

The professor is really nice but his way of teaching is a bit confusing for first time users in Blender.I have no experience in Blender. I read the book, watchd online tutorials, and attended clas sometimes and managed to get a C+. Although 3D modeling was hard and frustrating, I still had fun making creations and the teacher was really nice.

CMPS 25 seems like its an easy GE/5credit course, its NOT. The course load is way too much, you have better things to do in life. HW weekly - can easily take hours if you have no experience with 3d modeling. Tests - no study guide, 50 mult choice, he can ask anything about the use of the program and the program is HUGE. No quizzes, only 1 good TA.
